During an emergency situation, remember these three essential steps: Secure the Place: Ensure safety by preventing further incidents or harm. It may includes shutting off power sources or evacuating the area Alert Authorities: Call the appropriate emergency phone number to inform and seek professional assistance. Provide your name your location and a detailed description of what is happening. Act Responsibly: Follow emergency protocols, provide aid if possible, or evacuate calmly.

1. loosen the victim\'s collar, belt, or tie.

2. Place one hand on the victim\'s forehead and gently tilt their head. At the same time, position the fingertips of your other hand under the tip of the victim\'s chin and lift it to free the tongue from the back of the throat and clear the airway.

3. Check the victim's breathing:

 a. Ensure that the chest rises and falls regularly.

 b. Listen for breathing sounds by bringing your ear close to their mouth.

 c. Attempt to feel their breath by placing your cheek near their mouth for 10 seconds.
4. If the victim is breathing, place the person on the side in the recovery position
5. If the person is not breathing perform cardiac massage by following the next steps
5.1 Place the heel of one hand on the center of the person\'s chest, between the nipples.
5.2 Place your other hand on top of the first hand, interlocking your fingers.
5.3 Position yourself directly above the person\'s chest, with your shoulders aligned vertically above your hands.
5.4 Push hard and fast, using your body weight, to compress the chest at least 2 inches (5 centimeters) deep.
5.6 Allow the chest to fully recoil between compressions.
5.7 Perform chest compressions at a rate of 100 to 120 compressions per minute. (aim for 2 per second)
5.8 Continue performing uninterrupted chest compressions until help arrives or until an automated external defibrillator (AED) is available.
5.9 If an AED is nearby, follow its instructions for use..
